body_html:
Im facing the same problem, the inceptionv3 java code its not compatible with the python graph model mobilenet

Doing the modifications that tangyanlin suggested:

at exporter.py:346 I find those parameters:

restore_op_name='save/restore_all',
filename_tensor_name='save/Const:0',

After the change I have the following code

restore_op_name='deploy/save/restore_all',
filename_tensor_name='deploy/save/Const:0',

How can I proceed now?

  • I run exporter.py and will it automatically generate a new graph.pb? I tried with the parameters specified on the file, and not worked
  • Do I need to retrain with the new modification? How can you be sure that a new training will use the new parameter?
  • Do I need to train again from zero? At the final will generate a new graph.pb?

body:
Im facing the same problem, the inceptionv3 java code its not compatible with the python graph model mobilenet

Doing the modifications that **tangyanlin** suggested:

at exporter.py:346 I find those parameters:
```
restore_op_name='save/restore_all',
filename_tensor_name='save/Const:0',
```

After the change I have the following code
```
restore_op_name='deploy/save/restore_all',
filename_tensor_name='deploy/save/Const:0',
```
How can I proceed now?

- I run exporter.py and will it automatically generate a new graph.pb? I tried with the parameters specified on the file, and not worked
- Do I need to retrain with the new modification? How can you be sure that a new training will use the new parameter?
- Do I need to train again from zero? At the final will generate a new graph.pb?
